newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish lira/bond/forex closing report. [CORRECTED 15:00 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Turkish lira/bond/forex closing report. [CORRECTED 15:00 GMT]

text.p: The Turkish lira eased to 87,080 per dollar on Wednesday from 86,980 Tuesday close despite cash shortage.
Dealers say higher-than-expected consumer price data and the U.S. missile attack against Iraqi military targets helped the lira fall.
The central bank raised its dollar rate for banks' compulsory currency transfers to 87,000 lira at close, up from 86,950 at opening.

The central bank lent a total of 11.55 trillion lira, 7.75 trillion lira of that from today's five-day repo sale at an average of 72.1 percent, and 3.8 trillion lira (corrects from 7.4 trillion lira) from overnight money it lent at 75 percent.
The overnight money rate closed at 75 percent after moving between 69-74.75 percent during the day. The central bank had collected 4.4 trillion lira overnight cash on Tuesday.
In the t-bill market, yields fell by one-to-three points after the treasury's 112-day t-bill auction on Tuesday, when it sold 133.8 trillion lira t-bills.
The most active December 25 paper yield, sold at an average of 117.50 percent at yesterday's auction, fell to 115.50 percent.
The second active February 26 paper fell to 129.07 percent from 130.10 percent Tuesday close.
